thread.title: Liverpool to miss out on Gladbach star Mahmoud Dahoud to Borussia Dortmund
thread.title_full: Liverpool to miss out on Gladbach star Mahmoud Dahoud to Borussia Dortmund

author: gstonehouse
title: Liverpool to miss out on Gladbach star Mahmoud Dahoud to Borussia Dortmund
text:
Liverpool to miss out on Gladbach star Mahmoud Dahoud to Borussia Dortmund 
Jurgen Klopp's former side favourites to land Kop target, according to reports in Germany Gossip LIVERPOOL will miss out on Borussia Monchengladbach star Mahmoud Dahoud this summer, according to reports. 
The defensive midfielder is believed to one of Jurgen Klopp’s top transfer targets. Getty Images Mahmoud Dahoud is set to join Borussia Dortmund this summer over Liverpool 
The Premier League Reds have been tracking the German Under-21 ace for the past 12 months. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Premier League news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
However, Bild are claiming that his former club Borussia Dortmund are in the driving to land the 21-year-old. 
As talkSPORT reported in December, Bundesliga giants Bayern Munich are also interested the Gladbach man. Getty Images Jurgen Klopp has been monitoring the Gladbach star for the past 12 months EPA Moenchengladbach’s Mahmoud Dahoud (R) in action with Manchester City’s Fernandinho earlier this season Getty Images Dahoud is also on the radar of Bayern Munich and Juventus 
And Dahoud is on the radar of Serie A champions Juventus too. 
Bild are reporting that he has a clause in his contract that means he can leave for just £8.4million this year. 
And Dortmund are willing to stump up the cash to beat off their rivals to secure his signature. related articles Tottenham incredibly almost signed Diego Maradona - but pulled out because of his 'baggage' SIGH OF RELIEF John Stones 'thrilled to bits' to make amends by scoring in City's goalfest after defensive howler HUNG OUT TO PIE Celebs lead fans demanding Sutton keeper Wayne Shaw get his job back as he's SACKED by club for eating a pie in the dugout thanks to OTT novelty bet probe after club's Arsenal heroics NO GUNS ALLOWED North Ferriby 0 Lincoln 1: Arsenal scouts denied entry as their FA Cup quarter-final opponents keep promotion push on course LOTHAR’S LOWDOWN Sevilla are good enough to beat anyone on their day and I’m afraid they will be too good for Leicester Liverpool 2-0 Tottenham : Liverpool win for the first time this year
